text:
Message 3045 of 4024
Phew!!! I was worried you would see this before I admitted I was being frustrated in my tone about yesterday. Apologies for that. Sometimes it gets
the best of me. So just let me know when I can drop off his gifts! No more editorial comments necessary.
Sent:06/07/2024 at 01:36 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/07/2024 at 03:16 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian's Birthday
Message 3046 of 4024
He has a playdate with his friend tomorrow.
Perhaps you drop off at a neutral location (Rudolph’s) and I pick up, or hold until next week.
Sent:06/07/2024 at 03:18 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 06/07/2024 at 03:18 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian's Birthday
Message 3047 of 4024
Please don’t make this difficult. This is a very simple ask. I can do it before the play date or after. And I’m not going to the Rudolph’s.
Sent:06/07/2024 at 03:19 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/07/2024 at 03:35 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian's Birthday
Message 3048 of 4024
If you are asking to come to the house, the answer is no.
Sent:06/07/2024 at 03:38 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 06/07/2024 at 03:38 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian's Birthday
Message 3049 of 4024
I am asking you for your rules about giving my son his presents. I am not trying to force myself on anyone or any place. That is what this thread says-
your rules. I am happy to meet you at Sbux and do a drop-off or exchange. This is in AD's best interest.
It is healthy for him to see I care about him. I am 50% of him and when you teach him to hate me, you teach him to hate himself. Please let me know. I
can meet you as you go to the play date or after your workout if that makes it easier. This is a reasonable ask.
Sent:06/07/2024 at 03:46 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/07/2024 at 04:53 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian's Birthday
